sen.j: 知行国（ちぎょうこく）とは、古代・中世の日本において、有力貴族・寺社・武家が特定の令制国の知行権（国務権・吏務ともいう）を獲得し収益を得た制度、およびその国。
sen.e: Chigyo-koku indicates the provincial system and province in ancient and medieval Japan in which dominant nobles, shrines or temples acquired chigyo-ken (also called Kokumu-ken or rimu) (the right to manage the province) and obtained their revenues from there.

Chigyo-koku indicates the provincial system and province in ancient and medieval Japan in which dominant nobles, shrines or temples acquired chigyo-ken (also called Kokumu-ken or rimu) (the right to manage the province) and obtained their revenues from there.

Chigyo-koku indicates the provincial system and province in ancient and medieval Japan in which dominant nobles, shrines or temples acquired chigyo-ken (also called Kokumu-ken or rimu) (the right to manage the province) and obtained their revenues from there.

sen.j: 知行権を獲得した有力貴族・有力寺社らを知行国主といい、知行国主は、知行国の国司推薦権や官物収得権を保有した。
sen.e: A dominant noble, shrine or temple that acquired chigyo-ken was called chigyo-kokushu (provincial proprietor), and chigyo-kokushu had the right to make a recommendation of kokushi (provincial governors) of the province and the right to get kanmotsu (tribute goods paid as taxes or tithes).

A dominant noble, shrine or temple that acquired chigyo-ken was called chigyo-kokushu (provincial proprietor), and chigyo-kokushu had the right to make a recommendation of kokushi (provincial governors) of the province and the right to get kanmotsu (tribute goods paid as taxes or tithes).

A dominant noble, shrine or temple that acquired chigyo-ken was called chigyo-kokushu (provincial proprietor), and chigyo-kokushu had the right to make a recommendation of kokushi (provincial governors) of the province and the right to get kanmotsu (tribute goods paid as taxes or tithes).

sen.j: 知行国は「沙汰国」、「給国」ともいった。
sen.e: Chigyo-koku is also called "sata-koku" or "kyu-koku" as well.
Chigyo-koku is also called "sata-koku" or "kyu-koku" as well.
Chigyo-koku was also called "sata-koku" or "kyu-koku" as well.

sen.j: 知行国は、平安時代中期の院宮分国制に発端する。
sen.e: Chigyo-koku originated in the Ingu bunkoku-sei system (see the following description) in the middle era of the Heian period.
Chigyo-koku originated in the Ingu bunkoku-sei system (see the following description) in the middle era of the Heian period.
Chigyo-koku originated in the Ingu bunkoku-sei system (see the following description) in the middle era of the Heian period.

sen.j: 院宮分国制とは、年限を限って、院宮家（太上天皇・女院・皇后・中宮・東宮など）に特定国の国守（または受領）を推薦する権利を与えるとともに、当該国から上進される官物を院宮家が収納するという制度である。
sen.e: The ingu bunkoku-sei system is the system in which Innomiya families (the families of Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor), nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing), Empress, chugu (the second consort of an emperor) and Togu (the Crown Prince)) were given the right to make a recommendation of kokushu (or zuryo (the head of the provincial governors)) of a specific province and were also allowed to get the kanmotsu dedicated by the province.

The ingu bunkoku-sei system is the system in which Innomiya families (the families of Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor), nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing), Empress, chugu (the second consort of an emperor) and Togu (the Crown Prince)) were given the right to make a recommendation of kokushu (or zuryo (the head of the provincial governors)) of a specific province and were also allowed to get the kanmotsu dedicated by the province.

The ingu bunkoku-sei system is the system in which Innomiya families (the families of Daijo Tenno (the Retired Emperor), nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing), Empress, chugu (the second consort of an emperor) and Togu (the Crown Prince)) were given the right to make a recommendation of kokushu (or zuryo (the head of the provincial governors)) of a specific province and were also allowed to get the kanmotsu dedicated by the province.

sen.j: 院宮分国制は10世紀初頭から行われていた。
sen.e: The ingu bunkoku-sei system existed since from the early 10th century.
The ingu bunkoku-sei system existed from the early 10th century.
The ingu bunkoku-sei system existed from the early 10th century.

sen.j: 院宮家は、自らの側近や血縁者を国守・受領に任命することが通例であった。
sen.e: It was customary that Innomiya families appointed their close retainers or relatives to kokushu and zuryo.
It was customary that Innomiya families appointed their close retainers or relatives to kokushu and zuryo.
It was customary that Innomiya families appointed their close retainers or relatives to kokushu and zuryo.

sen.j: 11世紀から12世紀にかけて、院宮分国制が有力貴族の間にも拡がった。
sen.e: In the era from the 11th century to the 12th century, powerful nobles introduced a system similar to the ingu bunkoku-sei system as well.
In the era from the 11th century to the 12th century, powerful nobles introduced a system similar to the ingu bunkoku-sei system as well.
In the era from the 11th century to the 12th century, powerful nobles introduced a system similar to the ingu bunkoku-sei system as well.

sen.j: その政治権力を背景として、有力貴族らが縁者や係累を特定の国の受領に任命することが徐々に慣例化していき、現地へ赴任した受領の俸料・得分を自らの経済的収益としたのである。
sen.e: With their political power as a background, it became customary gradually that powerful nobles appointed their relatives or dependents to zuryo of specific provinces, and they acquired, as their revenues, the salary and tax gained by the zuryo they sent to the provinces.

With their political power as a background, it gradually became a custom that powerful nobles appointed their relatives or dependents to zuryo of specific provinces, and they acquired, as their revenues, the salary and tax gained by the zuryo they sent to the provinces.

With their political power as a background, it gradually became a custom that powerful nobles appointed their relatives or dependents to zuryo of specific provinces, and they acquired, as their revenues, the salary and tax gained by the zuryo they sent to the provinces.

sen.j: これが知行国制の始まりである。
sen.e: This was the origin of the chigokoku system.
This was the origin of the chigokoku system.
This was the origin of the chigo-koku system.
sen.cmt: 前出の表記に合わせ、chigyokoku→chigyo-kokuに修正

sen.j: 院宮分国制と知行国制とは元来、異なる制度である。
sen.e: The ingu bunkoku-sei system and the chigokoku system were different originally.
The ingu bunkoku-sei system and the chigokoku system were different originally.
The ingu bunkoku-sei system and the chigo-koku system were different originally.

sen.j: 院宮分国制は国家公認の制度であり、院宮分国からの上進官物は院宮家の収入とすることができた。
sen.e: The ingu bunkoku-sei system was an official system of the nation, and Innomiya families were allowed to acquire, as their revenues, the kanmotsu dedicated by the ingu bunkoku provinces.
The ingu bunkoku-sei system was an official system of the nation, and Innomiya families were allowed to acquire, as their revenues, the kanmotsu dedicated by the ingu bunkoku provinces.
The ingu bunkoku-sei system was an official system of the nation, and Innomiya families were allowed to acquire, as their revenues, the kanmotsu dedicated by the ingu bunkoku provinces.

sen.j: それに対し、知行国制は国家として公認されたものでなかった。
sen.e: On the other hand, the chigokoku system was not approved officially.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, the chigokoku system was not approved officially.
On the other hand, the chigo-koku system was not approved officially.

sen.j: そのため、知行国からの上進官物は国家へ納付しなければならず、知行国主が獲得しえたのは（本来、受領の収入となるべき）受領の俸料・得分のみであった。
sen.e: Therefore, the kanmotsu dedicated by the chigyo-koku provinces had to be delivered to the nation, with only the salary and tax gained by the zuryo (which originally should be zuryo's won income) allowed to be acquired by chigyo-kokushu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the kanmotsu dedicated by the chigyo-koku provinces had to be delivered to the nation, with only the salary and tax gained by the zuryo (which originally should be zuryo's won income) allowed to be acquired by chigyo-kokushu.

Therefore, the kanmotsu dedicated by the chigyo-koku provinces had to be delivered to the nation, with only the salary and tax gained by the zuryo (which originally should be zuryo's won income) allowed to be acquired by chigyo-kokushu.

sen.j: ゆえに、一つの国がある院宮家の分国であると同時に、ある貴族・寺社の知行国であるという状況も十分あり得たのであり、実際そうした事例もあったと考えられている。
sen.e: Therefore, it could occur that a province was not only a bunkoku (a province under control) of an Innomiya family but also a chigyo-koku province under control of a noble, shrine or temple, and it is considered that such examples existed actually.

Therefore, it could occur that a province was not only a bunkoku (a province under control) of an Innomiya family but also a chigyo-koku province under control of a noble, shrine or temple, and it is considered that such examples existed actually.

Therefore, it could occur that a province was not only a bunkoku (a province under control) of an Innomiya family but also a chigyo-koku province under control of a noble, shrine or temple, and it is considered that such examples existed actually.

sen.j: この場合、国の上進官物は院宮家に納入され、受領の俸料・得分は知行国主へ納入されることとなる。
sen.e: In this case, the kanmotsu dedicated to the nation was delivered to the Innomiya family concerned and the salary and tax gained by the zuryo was paid to the chigo-kokushu.
In this case, the kanmotsu dedicated to the nation was delivered to the Innomiya family concerned and the salary and tax gained by the zuryo was paid to the chigo-kokushu.
In this case, the kanmotsu dedicated to the nation was delivered to the Innomiya family concerned and the salary and tax gained by the zuryo was paid to the chigyo-kokushu.

sen.j: 院宮分国と知行国は、ともに院政期（11世紀後葉以降）に急激に増加した。
sen.e: Ingu bunkoku provinces and chigyo-koku provinces increased rapidly in the insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor) (in the latter half the 11th century and later).
Ingu bunkoku provinces and chigyo-koku provinces increased rapidly in the insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor) (in the latter half the 11th century and later).
Ingu bunkoku provinces and chigyo-koku provinces increased rapidly in the insei period (during the period of the government by the Retired Emperor) (in the latter half the 11th century and later).

sen.j: 摂政・関白が同時に2 - 3か国を知行国とすることが珍しくなくなった。
sen.e: It was not rare that Sessho (a regent) or Kanpaku (the top adviser to Emperor) had two or three chigyo-koku provinces.
It was not rare that Sessho (a regent) or Kanpaku (the top adviser to Emperor) had two or three chigyo-koku provinces.
It was not rare that Sessho (a regent) or Kanpaku (the top adviser to Emperor) had two or three chigyo-koku provinces.

sen.j: また当初、有力貴族層を中心としていた知行国制だった。
sen.e: Initially, the chigyo-koku system was used mostly by powerful nobles
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Initially, the chigyo-koku system was used mostly by powerful nobles
Initially, the chigyo-koku system was used mostly by powerful nobles.

sen.j: しかしながら、12世紀後半から寺社知行国や武家知行国が行われるようになった。
sen.e: However, from the latter half of the 12th century, the chigyo-koku provinces controlled by shrines or temples and those by samurai appeared.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, from the latter half of the 12th century, the chigyo-koku provinces controlled by shrines or temples and those by samurai appeared.
However, from the latter half of the 12th century, the chigyo-koku provinces controlled by shrines or temples and those by samurai appeared.

sen.j: 平安末期の平氏政権期には、30数か国が平氏一門の知行国になったとされている。
sen.e: It is said that, in the Taira clan government towards the end of the Heian period, thirty plus provinces became chigyo-koku provinces of the Taira clan.
It is said that, in the Taira clan government towards the end of the Heian period, thirty plus provinces became chigyo-koku provinces of the Taira clan.
It is said that, in the Taira clan government towards the end of the Heian period, thirty plus provinces became chigyo-koku provinces of the Taira clan.

sen.j: 12世紀終わりに鎌倉幕府政権が樹立すると、関東の9か国が鎌倉殿の知行国 関東御分国となった。
sen.e: When the Kamakura bakufu was established towards the end of the 12th century, nine provinces in the Kanto region became chigyo-koku provinces of Kamakura-dono (lord of Kamakura), or provincial territories belonged to the Kamakura bakufu.

When the Kamakura bakufu was established towards the end of the 12th century, nine provinces in the Kanto region became chigyo-koku provinces of Kamakura-dono (lord of Kamakura), or provincial territories belonged to the Kamakura bakufu.

When the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was established towards the end of the 12th century, nine provinces in the Kanto region became chigyo-koku provinces of Kamakura-dono (lord of Kamakura), or provincial territories belonged to the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 大仏殿再建を名目として造営料国となった周防国も、実質的には東大寺の知行国であり、大仏殿再建後も東大寺の知行下にあり続けた。
sen.e: Suo province that was assigned to the task of reconstructing Daibutsu-den Hall (the great Buddha hall) of Todai-ji Temple was virtually a chigyo-koku province of Todai-ji Temple, and the province continued being under control of Todai-ji Temple even after the work to reconstruct Daibutsu-den Hall was completed.

Suo province that was assigned to the task of reconstructing Daibutsu-den Hall (the great Buddha hall) of Todai-ji Temple was virtually a chigyo-koku province of Todai-ji Temple, and the province continued being under control of Todai-ji Temple even after the work to reconstruct Daibutsu-den Hall was completed.

Suo province that was assigned to the task of reconstructing Daibutsu-den Hall (the great Buddha hall) of Todai-ji Temple was virtually a chigyo-koku province of Todai-ji Temple, and the province continued being under control of Todai-ji Temple even after the work to reconstruct Daibutsu-den Hall was completed.

sen.j: このように知行国は増加の一途をたどり、1215年（建保3年）には知行国が50か国にのぼったとする記録も残されている。
sen.e: In this way, the number of chigyo-koku provinces continued increasing, and it is recorded that 50 chigyo-koku provinces existed in 1215.
In this way, the number of chigyo-koku provinces continued increasing, and it is recorded that 50 chigyo-koku provinces existed in 1215.
In this way, the number of chigyo-koku provinces continued increasing, and it is recorded that 50 chigyo-koku provinces existed in 1215.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には、知行国制が次第に公的な認知を得ていく。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, the chigyo-koku system became officially recognized gradually.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, the chigyo-koku system became officially recognized gradually.
In the Kamakura period, the chigyo-koku system became officially recognized gradually.

sen.j: それとともに、知行国主が特定の知行国を代々継承していく知行国の固定化が見られるようになる。
sen.e: At the same time, chigyo-kokushu became to hand over their chigyo-koku provinces to their heirs, fixing the relationship of chigyo-kokushu with specific provinces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the same time, chigyo-kokushu came to mean handing over their chigyo-koku provinces to their heirs, and fixing the relationship of chigyo-kokushu with specific provinces.
At the same time, chigyo-kokushu came to mean handing over their chigyo-koku provinces to their heirs, and fixing the relationship of chigyo-kokushu with specific provinces.

sen.j: 上記の関東御分国や東大寺知行国の周防などは知行国固定化の典型例である。
sen.e: The provincial territories belonged to the Kamakura bakufu and Suo were typical such examples.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The provincial territories belonging to the Kamakura bakufu and Suo were typical examples.
The provincial territories belonging to the Kamakura bakufu and Suo, a chigyo-koku province of Todai-ji Temple were typical examples.
sen.cmt: 「東大寺知行国の」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。

sen.j: が、この他、一条家の土佐国や西園寺家の伊予国などの例がある。
sen.e: In addition, Tosa Province and Iyo Province were also other such chigyo-koku province of the Ichijo family and that of the Saionji family, respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, Tosa Province and Iyo Province were also other chigyo-koku provinces of the Ichijo family and that of the Saionji family, respectively.
In addition, Tosa Province and Iyo Province were also other chigyo-koku provinces of the Ichijo family and that of the Saionji family, respectively.

sen.j: また本来、官物収得権は院宮家のみに認められていた
sen.e: The right to acquire kanmotsu was given only to Innomiya families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The right to acquire kanmotsu was given only to Innomiya families.
The right to acquire kanmotsu was given only to Innomiya families.

sen.j: が、知行国制が公的認知されるに伴って、知行国主が官物収得権を獲得する例も見られるようになった。
sen.e: However, as the chigyokoku system became recognized officially, some of chigyo-kokushu became to get the right to acquire kanmotsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, as the chigyokoku system became recognized officially, some of the chigyo-kokushu were bestowed the right to acquire kanmotsu.
However, as the chigyo-koku system became recognized officially, some of the chigyo-kokushu were bestowed the right to acquire kanmotsu.
sen.cmt: 他の表記と合わせ、chigyokoku→chigyo-kokuに修正

sen.j: 室町時代になると、守護の権限が積極的に拡大されていった。
sen.e: Entering the Muromachi period, the right of Shugo (provincial constable) was expanded actively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Entering the Muromachi period, the right of Shugo (provincial constable) was expanded actively.
Entering the Muromachi period, the right of Shugo (provincial constable) was expanded actively.

sen.j: その結果、刈田狼藉取締権・使節遵行権・半済給付権・闕所地処分権・段銭徴収権などを得た守護は、国内に領域的な支配を及ぼしていく。
sen.e: As a result, the Shugo who acquired the following rights became to control the province territorially: the right to control Karita-rozeki (to reap rice illegally), the right to send a delegate for executing the bakufu's order, the right to collect half of the taxes from manors and demesnes as military fund, the right to confiscate land property from criminals or if it is left derelict, and the right to collect temporary special tax levied on arable land.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, the Shugo who acquired the following rights came to control the province territorially: the right to control Karita-rozeki (to reap rice illegally), the right to send a delegate for executing the bakufu's order, the right to collect half of the taxes from manors and demesnes as military fund, the right to confiscate land property from criminals or if it is left derelict, and the right to collect temporary special tax levied on arable land.

As a result, the Shugo who acquired the following rights came to control the province territorially: the right to control Karita-rozeki (to reap rice illegally), the right to send a delegate for executing the bakufu's order, the right to collect half of the taxes from manors and demesnes as military fund, the right to confiscate land property from criminals or if it is left derelict, and the right to collect temporary special tax levied on arable land.

sen.j: そうした過程の中で、知行国支配の拠点であった国衙が守護の支配下に置かれると、知行国は消滅した。
sen.e: When kokuga (provincial government offices), which was the core site of controlling a chigyo-koku province, became placed under control of the Shugo in such a process, the chigyo-koku province became extinct.

When kokuga (provincial government offices), which was the core site of controlling a chigyo-koku province, became placed under control of the Shugo in such a process, the chigyo-koku province became extinct.

When kokuga (provincial government offices), which was the core site of controlling a chigyo-koku province, became placed under control of the Shugo in such a process, the chigyo-koku province became extinct.
